org.openimaj.tools.twitter.modes.preprocessing

Class TwitterPreprocessingMode<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.tools.twitter.modes.preprocessing.TwitterPreprocessingMode<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the analysis result
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CountryCodeMode, LanguageDetectionMode, NERMode, SentimentExtractionMode, StemmingMode, StopwordMode, TokeniseMode

    public abstract class TwitterPreprocessingMode<T>
extends Object
    A processing mode that is able to process a tweet and also typed on the data which it analyses from the tweet (so it can return this data if required)
    Author:
    Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

        Returns:
        for conveniance also returns the analysis

      • rdfAnalysisProvider

        public RDFAnalysisProvider rdfAnalysisProvider()
        Returns:
        by default this adds no analysis and does nothing whatsoever

      • results

        public static <Q> Q results(USMFStatus status,
                            TwitterPreprocessingMode<Q> mode)
                     throws Exception
        Given a twitter status, attempts to extract the analysis for this mode. If the analysis does not exist, the provided mode instance is used to create the analysis. If the provided mode is null a new mode is created. This mode creation might be slow, be careful about using this in this way.
        Type Parameters:
        Q -
        Parameters:
        status - the twitter status to be analysed
        mode - the mode to use if the analysis does no exist in the tweet
        Returns:
        the analysis results. These results are also injected into the tweet's analysis
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getAnalysisKey

        public abstract String getAnalysisKey()
        Returns:
        the keys this mode adds to the twitter analysis map
